00040 #ifndef _RFM12_H
00041 #define _RFM12_H

00043 /** \name States for rx and tx buffers
00044 * \anchor rxtx_states
00045 * \see rfm12_rx_status() and rfm12_control_t
00046 * @{
00047 */
00048 //! Indicates that the buffer is free
00049 #define STATUS_FREE 0
00050 //! Indicates that the buffer is in use by the library
00051 #define STATUS_OCCUPIED 1
00052 //! Indicates that a receive buffer holds a complete transmission
00053 #define STATUS_COMPLETE 2
00054 //@}
00055 
00056 
00057 /** \name  Return values for rfm12_tx() and rfm12_start_tx()
00058 * \anchor tx_retvals
00059 * \see rfm12_tx() and rfm12_start_tx()
00060 * @{
00061 */
00062 //!  The packet data is longer than the internal buffer
00063 #define RFM12_TX_ERROR 0x02
00064 //! The transmit buffer is already occupied
00065 #define RFM12_TX_OCCUPIED 0x03
00066 //! The packet has been enqueued successfully
00067 #define RFM12_TX_ENQUEUED 0x80
00068 //@}
00069

00072  * function protoypes
00073 */
00074 
00075 //see rfm12.c for more documentation
00076 void rfm12_init(void);
00077 void rfm12_tick(void);
00078 
00079 //if receive mode is not disabled (default)
00080 #if !(RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY)
00081          void rfm12_rx_clear(void);
00082 #endif /* !(RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY) */
00083 
00084 //FIXME: the tx function should return a status, do we need to do this also?
00085 // uint8_t rfm12_tx_status();
00086 
00087 #if (RFM12_NORETURNS)
00088 //see rfm12.c for more documentation
00089 void rfm12_start_tx(uint8_t type, uint8_t length);
00090 void rfm12_tx(uint8_t len, uint8_t type, uint8_t *data);
00091 #else
00092 uint8_t rfm12_start_tx(uint8_t type, uint8_t length);
00093 uint8_t rfm12_tx(uint8_t len, uint8_t type, uint8_t *data);
00094 #endif
00095

00098 void rfm12_poll(void);
00099 #endif

00102 /************************
00103  * private control structs
00104  */
00105 
00106 //! The transmission buffer structure.
00107 /** \note Note that this complete buffer is transmitted sequentially,
00108 * beginning with the sync bytes.
00109 *
00110 * \see rfm12_start_tx(), rfm12_tx() and rf_tx_buffer
00111 */
00112 typedef struct
00113 {
00114          //! Sync bytes for receiver to start filling fifo.
00115          uint8_t sync[2];
00116          
00117          //! Length byte - number of bytes in buffer.
00118          uint8_t len;
00119 
00120          //! Type field for the simple airlab protocol.
00121          uint8_t type;              
00122 
00123          //! Checksum over the former two members.
00124          uint8_t checksum;
00125 
00126          //! Buffer for the raw bytes to be transmitted.
00127          uint8_t buffer[RFM12_TX_BUFFER_SIZE];
00128 } rf_tx_buffer_t;
00129 
00130 
00131 //if receive mode is not disabled (default)
00132 #if !(RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY)
00133          //! The receive buffer structure.
00134          /** \note Note that there will be two receive buffers of this type,
00135          * as double buffering is being employed by this library.
00136          *
00137          * \see rfm12_rx_status(), rfm12_rx_len(), rfm12_rx_type(), rfm12_rx_buffer() , rfm12_rx_clear() and rf_rx_buffers
00138          */
00139          typedef struct
00140          {
00141                   //! Indicates if the buffer is free or completed.
00142                   /** \see \ref rxtx_states "States for rx and tx buffers" */
00143                   volatile uint8_t status;
00144                   
00145                   //! Length byte - number of bytes in buffer.
00146                   uint8_t len;
00147 
00148                   //! Type field for the simple airlab protocol.                 
00149                   uint8_t type;
00150                   
00151                   //! Checksum over the type and length header fields
00152                   uint8_t checksum;
00153                   
00154                   //! The actual receive buffer data
00155                   uint8_t buffer[RFM12_RX_BUFFER_SIZE]; 
00156          } rf_rx_buffer_t;
00157 #endif /* !(RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY) */ 
00158  
00159 
00160 //! Control and status structure.
00161 /** This data structure keeps all control and some status related variables. \n
00162 * By using a central structure for all global variables, the compiler can
00163 * use smaller instructions and reduce the size of the binary.
00164 *
00165 * \note Some states are defined in the non-documented rfm12_core.h header file.
00166 * \see ISR(RFM12_INT_VECT, ISR_NOBLOCK), rfm12_tick() and ctrl
00167 */
00168 typedef struct
00169 {
00170          //! This controls the library internal state machine.
00171          volatile uint8_t rfm12_state;
00172          
00173          //! Transmit buffer status.
00174          /** \see \ref rxtx_states "States for rx and tx buffers" */
00175          volatile uint8_t txstate;
00176          
00177          //! Number of bytes to transmit or receive.
00178          /** This refers to the overall data size, including header data and sync bytes. */
00179          uint8_t num_bytes;
00180          
00181          //! Counter for the bytes we are transmitting or receiving at the moment.
00182          uint8_t bytecount;
00183 
00184          //if receive mode is not disabled (default)
00185          #if !(RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY) 
00186                   //! Points to the receive buffer that will be filled next.
00187                   rf_rx_buffer_t * rf_buffer_in;
00188                   
00189                   //! Points to the receive buffer that will be returned for the next read.
00190                   rf_rx_buffer_t * rf_buffer_out;
00191                   
00192                   //! the number of the currently used in receive buffer.
00193                   uint8_t buffer_in_num;
00194                   
00195                   //! the number of the currently used out receive buffer.
00196                   uint8_t buffer_out_num;
00197          #endif /* !(RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY) */
00198          
00199          //wakeup timer feature
00200          #if RFM12_USE_WAKEUP_TIMER
00201                   //! Power management shadow register.
00202                   /** The wakeup timer feature needs to buffer the current power management state. */
00203                   uint16_t pwrmgt_shadow;
00204          #endif /* RFM12_USE_WAKEUP_TIMER */
00205          
00206          #if RFM12_LOW_BATT_DETECTOR
00207                   //! Low battery detector status.
00208                   /** \see \ref batt_states "States for the low battery detection feature",
00209                   * as well as rfm12_set_batt_detector() and rfm12_get_batt_status()
00210                   */
00211                   uint8_t low_batt;
00212          #endif /* RFM12_LOW_BATT_DETECTOR */
00213 } rfm12_control_t;
00214 
00215 
00216 /************************
00217  * GLOBALS
00218  */
00219 
00220 //Buffer and status for the message to be transmitted
00221 extern rf_tx_buffer_t rf_tx_buffer;
00222 
00223 //if receive mode is not disabled (default)
00224 #if !(RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY)
00225          //buffers for storing incoming transmissions
00226          extern rf_rx_buffer_t rf_rx_buffers[2];
00227 #endif /* !(RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY) */
00228 
00229 //the control struct
00230 extern rfm12_control_t ctrl;
00231 
00232 
00233 /************************
00234  * INLINE FUNCTIONS
00235  */
00236 
00237 //if receive mode is not disabled (default)
00238 #if !(RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY)
00239          //! Inline function to return the rx buffer status byte.
00240          /** \returns STATUS_FREE or STATUS_COMPLETE
00241          * \see \ref rxtx_states "rx buffer states", rfm12_rx_len(), rfm12_rx_type(), rfm12_rx_buffer(), rfm12_rx_clear() and rf_rx_buffer_t
00242          */
00243          static inline uint8_t rfm12_rx_status(void)
00244          {
00245                   return ctrl.rf_buffer_out->status;
00246          }
00247 
00248          //! Inline function to return the rx buffer length field.
00249          /** \returns The length of the data inside the buffer
00250          * \see rfm12_rx_status(), rfm12_rx_type(), rfm12_rx_buffer(), rfm12_rx_clear() and rf_rx_buffer_t
00251          */
00252          static inline uint8_t rfm12_rx_len(void)
00253          {
00254                   return ctrl.rf_buffer_out->len;
00255          }
00256 
00257          //! Inline function to return the rx buffer type field.
00258          /** \returns The packet type from the packet header type field
00259          * \see rfm12_rx_status(), rfm12_rx_len(), rfm12_rx_buffer(), rfm12_rx_clear() and rf_rx_buffer_t
00260          */
00261          static inline uint8_t rfm12_rx_type(void)
00262          {
00263                   return ctrl.rf_buffer_out->type;
00264          }
00265 
00266          //! Inline function to retreive current rf buffer contents.
00267          /** \returns A pointer to the current receive buffer contents
00268          * \see rfm12_rx_status(), rfm12_rx_len(), rfm12_rx_type(), rfm12_rx_clear() and rf_rx_buffer_t
00269          */
00270          static inline uint8_t *rfm12_rx_buffer(void)
00271          {
00272                   return (uint8_t*) ctrl.rf_buffer_out->buffer;
00273          }
00274 #endif /* !(RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY) */
00275

00279  * this way the user only needs to include rfm12.h
00280 */

00282 #include "include/rfm12_ctrl.h"
